definitions.text: all of something including all its component elements or parts
an assemblage of parts that is regarded as a single entity
examples: how big is that part compared to the whole?

definitions.text: including all components without exception; being one unit or constituting the full amount or extent or duration; complete
examples: a whole wardrobe for the tropics
the baby cried the whole trip home

definitions.text: exhibiting or restored to vigorous good health
acting together as a single undiversified whole
to a complete degree or to the full or entire extent (`whole' is often used informally for `wholly')
examples: it was completely different from what we expected
it was not altogether her fault
